briefdescription.para: constructs a standalone cudaFlow
destroys the cudaFlow and its associated native CUDA graph and executable graph
queries the emptiness of the graph
dumps the cudaFlow graph into a DOT format through an output stream
dumps the native CUDA graph into a DOT format through an output stream

detaileddescription.para: The native CUDA graph may be different from the upper-level cudaFlow graph when flow capture is involved.

briefdescription.para: creates a no-operation task

detaileddescription.para:
a tf::cudaTask handle
An empty node performs no operation during execution, but can be used for transitive ordering. For example, a phased execution graph with 2 groups of n nodes with a barrier between them can be represented using an empty node and 2*n dependency edges, rather than no empty node and n^2 dependency edges.

briefdescription.para: creates a host task that runs a callable on the host

detaileddescription.para:
C
callable type
callable
a callable object with neither arguments nor return (i.e., constructible from std::function<void()>)
a tf::cudaTask handle
A host task can only execute CPU-specific functions and cannot do any CUDA calls (e.g., cudaMalloc).

memberdef.argsstring: (dim3 g, dim3 b, size_t s, F &&f, ArgsT &&... args)
memberdef.name: kernel

briefdescription.para: creates a kernel task

parameterdescription.para: arguments to forward to the kernel function by copy

memberdef.argsstring: (int d, dim3 g, dim3 b, size_t s, F &&f, ArgsT &&... args)
memberdef.name: kernel_on

briefdescription.para: creates a kernel task on a specific GPU

parameterdescription.para: device identifier to launch the kernel
arguments to forward to the kernel function by copy

briefdescription.para: creates a memset task that fills untyped data with a byte value

detaileddescription.para:
dst
pointer to the destination device memory area
v
value to set for each byte of specified memory
count
size in bytes to set
a tf::cudaTask handle
A memset task fills the first count bytes of device memory area pointed by dst with the byte value v.

briefdescription.para: creates a memcpy task that copies untyped data in bytes

detaileddescription.para:
tgt
pointer to the target memory block
src
pointer to the source memory block
bytes
bytes to copy
a tf::cudaTask handle
A memcpy task transfers bytes of data from a source location to a target location. Direction can be arbitrary among CPUs and GPUs.

briefdescription.para: creates a memset task that sets a typed memory block to zero

detaileddescription.para:
T
element type (size of T must be either 1, 2, or 4)
dst
pointer to the destination device memory area
count
number of elements
a tf::cudaTask handle
A zero task zeroes the first count elements of type T in a device memory area pointed by dst.

briefdescription.para: creates a memset task that fills a typed memory block with a value

detaileddescription.para:
T
element type (size of T must be either 1, 2, or 4)
dst
pointer to the destination device memory area
value
value to fill for each element of type T
count
number of elements
a tf::cudaTask handle
A fill task fills the first count elements of type T with value in a device memory area pointed by dst. The value to fill is interpreted in type T rather than byte.

briefdescription.para: creates a memcopy task that copies typed data

detaileddescription.para:
T
element type (non-void)
tgt
pointer to the target memory block
src
pointer to the source memory block
num
number of elements to copy
a tf::cudaTask handle
A copy task transfers num*sizeof(T) bytes of data from a source location to a target location. Direction can be arbitrary among CPUs and GPUs.

briefdescription.para: offloads the cudaFlow onto a GPU and repeatedly runs it until the predicate becomes true

detaileddescription.para:
P
predicate type (a binary callable)
predicate
a binary predicate (returns true for stop)
Immediately offloads the present cudaFlow onto a GPU and repeatedly runs it until the predicate returns true.
An offloaded cudaFlow forces the underlying graph to be instantiated. After the instantiation, you should not modify the graph topology but update node parameters.
By default, if users do not offload the cudaFlow, the executor will offload it once.

briefdescription.para: offloads the cudaFlow and executes it by the given times
offloads the cudaFlow and executes it once
updates parameters of a host task created from tf::cudaFlow::host

detaileddescription.para: The method updates the parameters of a host callable associated with the given task.

memberdef.argsstring: (cudaTask task, dim3 g, dim3 b, size_t shm, ArgsT &&... args)
memberdef.name: update_kernel

briefdescription.para: updates parameters of a kernel task created from tf::cudaFlow::kernel

detaileddescription.para: The method updates the parameters of a kernel associated with the given task. We do not allow you to change the kernel function.

memberdef.name: update_copy

briefdescription.para: updates parameters of a memcpy task to form a copy task

detaileddescription.para: The method updates the parameters of a copy task. The source/destination memory may have different address values but must be allocated from the same contexts as the original source/destination memory.

memberdef.argsstring: (cudaTask task, void *tgt, const void *src, size_t bytes)
memberdef.name: update_memcpy

briefdescription.para: updates parameters of a memcpy task

detaileddescription.para: The method updates the parameters of a memcpy task. The source/destination memory may have different address values but must be allocated from the same contexts as the original source/destination memory.

memberdef.argsstring: (cudaTask task, void *dst, int ch, size_t count)
memberdef.name: update_memset

briefdescription.para: updates parameters of a memset task

detaileddescription.para: The method updates the parameters of a memset task. The source/destination memory may have different address values but must be allocated from the same contexts as the original source/destination memory.

memberdef.argsstring: (cudaTask task, T *dst, T value, size_t count)
memberdef.name: update_fill

briefdescription.para: updates parameters of a memset task to form a fill task

detaileddescription.para: The method updates the parameters of a copy task. The given arguments and type must comply with the rules of tf::cudaFlow::fill. The source/destination memory may have different address values but must be allocated from the same contexts as the original source/destination memory.

briefdescription.para: updates parameters of a memset task to form a zero task

detaileddescription.para: The method updates the parameters of a copy task. The given arguments and type must comply with the rules of tf::cudaFlow::zero. The source/destination memory may have different address values but must be allocated from the same contexts as the original source/destination memory.

detaileddescription.para:
C
callable type constructible from std::function<void(tf::cudaFlowCapturer&)>
callable
the callable to construct a capture flow
a tf::cudaTask handle
A captured subflow forms a sub-graph to the cudaFlow and can be used to capture custom (or third-party) kernels that cannot be directly constructed from the cudaFlow.
Example usage:

briefdescription.para: class for building a CUDA task dependency graph

detaileddescription.para: A cudaFlow is a high-level interface over CUDA Graph to perform GPU operations using the task dependency graph model. The class provides a set of methods for creating and launch different tasks on one or multiple CUDA devices, for instance, kernel tasks, data transfer tasks, and memory operation tasks. The following example creates a cudaFlow of two kernel tasks, task_1 and task_2, where task_1 runs before task_2.
A cudaFlow is a task (tf::Task) created from tf::Taskflow and will be run by one worker thread in the executor. That is, the callable that describes a cudaFlow will be executed sequentially.
